decks.notes: The central idea of this Control - Simic Control deck is to use a combination of card advantage, mana ramp, and disruption to take control of the game. By utilizing cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, the deck aims to generate value and outscale the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf to both stabilize the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes counterspells like Aether Gust and tempo plays with Brazen Borrower to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of powerful Simic cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, allowing for the early casting of threats like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf. With the addition of cards like Mass Manipulation and Brazen Borrower, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing its own game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells while maintaining control of the board.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Simic cards like Nissa, Oko, and Hydroid Krasis to control the game by generating value through ramping and card advantage. By using efficient threats and disruptive spells like Aether Gust, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan, with a mix of lands that can produce both green and blue mana. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and planeswalkers.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and powerful planeswalkers, such as Oko and Nissa. The main win conditions are Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf, which can both generate card advantage and be difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck also utilizes ramp with Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose to quickly get to its powerful threats. The inclusion of Fabled Passage and Once Upon a Time helps ensure consistency in card draw and mana fixing. Ultimately, the deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents through a combination of removal, ramp, and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. It combines powerful cards like Lovestruck Beast, Rankle, Master of Pranks, and Murderous Rider to quickly build a threatening board presence. The inclusion of cards like Noxious Grasp and Legion's End helps to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain tempo and aggression throughout the game, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and removal spells.

The focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly populate the board with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Venerated Loxodon, and Giant Killer, supported by cards like March of the Multitudes and Unbreakable Formation to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Conclave Tribunal and Shepherd of the Flock to control the board and maintain pressure. Card draw is provided by Edgewall Innkeeper, allowing for constant threats to be deployed. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and finish the game quickly through aggressive plays.

The main theme of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control and mana advantage through efficient creature removal and counter spells, while generating card advantage and ramp with Nissa and Hydroid Krasis. Oko serves as a versatile threat and disruption piece, while Wicked Wolf provides additional removal. The deck aims to stabilize the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats, utilizing the flexibility of its spells to adapt to various matchups and situations. The deck also utilizes mana dorks like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose to ramp into its higher-costed threats quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements in the form of removal spells and planeswalkers to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By ramping up mana with creatures like Paradise Druid and land enchantments like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf to overwhelm the opponent. The combination of efficient removal spells like Noxious Grasp and versatile planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns allows the deck to adapt to various situations and control the board effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko to control the board state and generate advantage. It also includes efficient creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf to apply pressure and interact with the opponent's board. Additionally, the deck includes utility cards like Brazen Borrower and Once Upon a Time to further support its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to establish and maintain control of the game through a mix of powerful threats and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to utilize powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Oko, and Vraska to control the game by generating value, disrupting the opponent's strategy, and staying ahead on resources. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Wicked Wolf and Hydroid Krasis to apply pressure and gain card advantage. With a mix of removal spells like Noxious Grasp and The Elderspell, as well as mana ramp from cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a drawn-out battle of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Oko, and Vraska, along with efficient creatures like Wicked Wolf and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Casualties of War to handle threats from the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirement of Sultai Control, with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid helping to ramp up to the higher-cost spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of planeswalkers, creatures, and removal.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong control over the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko, along with efficient creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, while also having access to counterspells and removals like Aether Gust and Mass Manipulation to maintain board control. With a mix of card advantage and powerful threats, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately control the flow of the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by playing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko, as well as utilizing cards like Wicked Wolf and Hydroid Krasis to maintain board presence. The deck also includes counterspells like Aether Gust and Mass Manipulation to handle the opponent's threats. The mana base is built around efficient ramp cards like Paradise Druid and Gilded Goose, allowing the deck to quickly play its high-cost spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient card advantage and powerful creature threats.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Rimrock Knight, and Questing Beast, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Edgewall Innkeeper provides card advantage, while Domri's Ambush and Embercleave serve as powerful removal and finishers. With a balanced mana base of Forests and Mountains, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, sacrificing creatures for value, and generating card advantage. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Midnight Reaper, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while keeping their resources in check with cards like Noxious Grasp and Angrath's Rampage. The deck also aims to ramp up to powerful threats like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Vraska, Golgari Queen to close out the game. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent gameplay.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures from the Simic color combination. Nissa, Who Shakes the World allows for explosive mana generation, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf provide strong threats. The deck also includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Aether Gust for disruption, and Hydroid Krasis for card draw and lifegain. With a mix of ramp, removal, and card advantage, this deck looks to quickly build a powerful board presence and outpace the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by using powerful creatures and planeswalkers with abilities that can disrupt their game plan. The deck includes a mix of efficient threats like Wicked Wolf and Hydroid Krasis, along with disruptive spells like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute to control the opponent's actions. The lands in the deck are also optimized to ensure a smooth mana curve and consistent access to the deck's key colors.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with aggressive creatures such as Nissa, Oko, and Wicked Wolf. The deck utilizes mana accelerators like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid to ramp into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis. Interaction comes in the form of Aether Gust to disrupt opponent's plans. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient spells while maintaining a consistent mana base with lands like Breeding Pool and Mobilized District to support the aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this Simic Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Growth Spiral, while also maintaining control of the board with counterspells like Frilled Mystic and Aether Gust. Nightpack Ambusher provides a steady stream of wolves to pressure the opponent, while Brazen Borrower and Brineborn Cutthroat offer additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful spells, using its blue and green mana base to stay ahead in tempo and card advantage.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and versatile creatures to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. By ramping up with mana dorks like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, the deck can quickly play threats like Nissa and Hydroid Krasis. Removal spells such as Noxious Grasp and Casualties of War can deal with opponent's threats, while cards like Oko provide additional disruption. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color strategy, allowing for consistent plays and flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control and outvalue the opponent through powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Aether Gust to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck aims to ramp into its powerful threats using cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, while also having the flexibility to find key cards with Once Upon a Time.

The focus of this deck is on gaining control of the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Oko, and Vraska to dominate the board and outvalue the opponent. With a solid mana base and efficient ramp cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, this deck aims to play threats ahead of curve while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Noxious Grasp. With a mix of card advantage engines and powerful threats, this Sultai Control deck looks to grind out wins through attrition and outlasting the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the pace of the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Oko, and Vraska, along with disruptive spells like Aether Gust and Noxious Grasp. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, while also having strong creature threats like Wicked Wolf and Hydroid Krasis. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of green, blue, and black, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities. Overall, the deck focuses on board control and resource management to outlast and out-value the opponent.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko to take control of the board, while utilizing efficient removal spells like Noxious Grasp to deal with threats. The deck also ramps up mana quickly with cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing for early drops of big threats like Hydroid Krasis. Fae of Wishes provides additional versatility by fetching important sideboard cards. Overall, the deck is about controlling the game and overwhelming opponents with powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control through the use of powerful removal spells and creature abilities. The deck utilizes cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Vraska, Golgari Queen to control the opponent's creatures, while also utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Trail of Crumbs to generate value and maintain a strong board presence. Additionally, the deck includes a strong mana base and card selection tools like Once Upon a Time to consistently draw into key pieces and control the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent through powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Oko, Thief of Crowns. It also utilizes the Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven combo to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Massacre Girl acts as a board wipe option, while cards like Noxious Grasp and Murderous Rider serve as removal spells. The deck aims to gain incremental advantages over the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, ultimately grinding out a win.

This Temur Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Sarkhan, Nissa, and Oko to control the board and generate value over the course of the game. It also includes disruptive creatures like Brazen Borrower and Questing Beast to deal with threats, while ramping up with Arboreal Grazer and Gilded Goose. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and outvalue the opponent through card advantage, efficient removal, and versatile threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and managing the board with removal spells. It also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to eventually close out the game with powerful spells like Expansion/Explosion. The deck focuses on tempo and card advantage to outlast the opponent and win through a mix of card advantage and powerful threats like Brazen Borrower and Escape to the Wilds.

The main idea of this Sultai Control deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko and Vraska, along with efficient removal spells and card advantage engines like Trail of Crumbs. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Noxious Grasp and Massacre Girl while generating value with Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven combo. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control and inevitability.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control through removal spells like Casualties of War and Vraska, Golgari Queen, while also generating card advantage and ramp through cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Negate and powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also providing flexibility and consistency in mana production. Overall, the deck focuses on outvaluing the opponent and controlling the game state until a win condition can be established.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Oko, and Garruk to generate value and create board presence. The deck includes removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Aether Gust to deal with threats from the opponent, as well as powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf to stabilize the board. With mana ramp from cards like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful removal spells and sacrificing small creatures to generate value and control the game. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Vraska, Golgari Queen help to control the board, while Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven provide a recurring source of damage. Massacre Girl can clear the board of smaller threats, while cards like Noxious Grasp and Murderous Rider deal with larger threats. The deck also includes card draw and ramp spells like Once Upon a Time and Gilded Goose to ensure consistency and access to resources.
